Dear Mr. Christian:
This will•acknowledge receipt of your recent letter in which
you urge that the Educational Television Facilities Act he
expanded to include broadcasting as well as television.
For your information, I am enclosing a copy of S. Il60, a
bill which amends the Communications Act of 1934 by extending and
improving the provisions thereof relating to grants for construc¬
tion of educational television broadcasting facilities, by
authorizing assistance in the construction of noncommercial edu¬
cational radio broadcasting facilities, by establishing a nonprofit
corporation to assist in establishing innovative educational
programs, to facilitate educational program availability, and to
aid the operation of educational broadcasting facilities; and to
authorize a comprehensive study of instructional television and
radio.
I am hopeful that hearings will be scheduled in the very near
future and have directed that your name be noted so a copy of the
notice can be forwarded to you.
S^icerely your:
